clinicalContextSummary.diagnosis: Chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps, bilateral
clinicalContextSummary.procedure: Functional Endoscopic Sinus Surgery (FESS) with bilateral total ethmoidectomy, right maxillary antrostomy, left frontal sinusotomy, bilateral nasal polypectomy
clinicalContextSummary.indication: Refractory symptoms of sinusitis and nasal obstruction, unresponsive to maximal medical therapy
clinicalContextSummary.key_findings: Diffuse polyposis, edematous mucosa, purulent drainage, polypoid tissue obstructing all sinuses involved
clinicalContextSummary.anatomical_site: Nasal cavity, ethmoid, maxillary, frontal sinuses
